headline: Pondering the Glorious Oddity  Of a Springlike January Weekend
abstract: A wave of warm weather across the Northeast broke temperature records and left many people wondering about a “January thaw.”
lead_paragraph: It sure didn’t feel like January in the Northeast over the past few days. At the time of year when the days are near their shortest and the weather should be near its coldest, temperatures across the region warmed to the high 60s and low 70s — 30 to 35 degrees above average. Records for daily highs were broken from Columbus, Ohio, and Pittsburgh to New York City and Bangor, Maine. Many residents took the warm spell as a belated holiday gift and went outside to cycle or jog or picnic with friends and family as if it were spring.
